title: TNIP1
text:
TNFAIP3-interacting protein 1, also known as ABIN-1, is a <a href="protein">protein</a> that in humans is encoded by the "TNIP1" <a href="gene">gene</a>.
Association with autoimmune diseases.
<a href="Human%20genetic%20variation">Genetic variations</a> within the region of the "TNIP1" gene have been shown to have <a href="Genetic%20association">association</a> with several <a href="autoimmune%20disease">autoimmune disease</a>s:
TNIP1 dysfunction or deficiency contributes to hyperinflammarion and may predispose healthy cells to the inflammatory response to otherwise innocuous <a href="Toll-like%20receptor">TLR</a> ligand exposure.
Association with neurodegenerative diseases.
A recent genome-wide association study (GWAS) has found that genetic variations in "TNIP1" are associated with <a href="Alzheimer%27s%20disease">late-onset sporadic Alzheimer’s disease (LOAD)</a>.
Interactions.
TNIP1 contains multiple <a href="amino%20acid">amino acid</a> sites that are <a href="phosphorylated">phosphorylated</a> and <a href="ubiquitinated">ubiquitinated</a>, and has been shown to <a href="Protein-protein%20interaction">interact</a> with <a href="TNFAIP3">TNFAIP3</a>, <a href="MAP3K1">MAP3K1</a>, and <a href="MAPK1">MAPK1</a>.
Regulation.
"TNIP1" was shown to be part of a transcription module controlled by "BCL3. <a href="BCL3">BCL3</a>" gen was found to be strongly associated with Aβ42 after conditioning for "<a href="Apolipoprotein%20E">APOE</a>" and was found as upregulated in the brain of patients with LOAD.
